headline: Stock Markets Are Gripped by Bank Loan Fears. Why the Fed Should Be in Focus.
summary: More credit “cockroaches” could be lurking at banks, Oracle fights low-margin cloud claims, U.S. and China still open to talks on trade, and more news to start your day.

headline: Examining the Value of ADM Stock After 25% Gain and Strong Q1 Earnings in 2025
summary: Thinking about what to do next with Archer-Daniels-Midland stock? You are not alone. ADM just wrapped up a solid few months on the market, with a striking 25.2% gain year-to-date. While short-term pops like last week’s 2.6% return catch headlines, the longer-term picture is a bit more nuanced. The stock is up almost 40% over the past five years, but down nearly 22% over the past three. Investors have been weighing changes in global demand and volatility in agricultural commodity prices, all...

headline: A Fresh Look at Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM) Valuation Following Trade Tensions, New Highs, and Strategic Milestones
summary: Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM) is gaining new attention as trade tensions between the US and China escalate. This has sparked talk of a cooking oil embargo and caused China to shift away from US soybeans. With these recent changes in the global agricultural landscape, ADM shares have reached a fresh 52-week high. The company has also moved quickly to meet key regenerative agriculture targets ahead of schedule, boosting investor curiosity even further. See our latest analysis for...

headline: What Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM)'s Supply Chain Advantage Amid U.S.-China Trade Tensions Means For Shareholders
summary: In recent days, escalating U.S.-China trade tensions and threats of export restrictions on Chinese cooking oil have drawn attention to major agribusiness firms such as Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM). Industry commentary suggests that expected changes in trade flows and supply chain disruptions are positioning U.S.-based oil-seed processors to benefit as investors anticipate shifts in the renewable fuels sector. We'll examine how potential export restrictions and supply chain changes could...
